text:
i am struggling. i need help. the previous weeks have been very challenging for me. sometimes, i don't even know how two steps connects. for example, i don't know which stage database population comes in and why it's needed. when i have multiple disconnections like this i feel overwhelmed and it affects my work for that week. 

i've realized that i work best when i have step by step guide of what needs to be done. i know that our tasks are not provided in that format but going forward it's the first thing i want to do on mondays and i need you guys to help me with it.

text:
so, for week 4. this is as far as my understanding goes on the challenge. 

1. read up extensively on llp
2.   set up dvc and cml
3.   jupyter notebooks: eda on the datasets
4.   python: prompts engineering using api (still not sure how to fine tune with this yet)
5.  fastapi or flask api endpoint (i don't know how to go about this or even if it's step 5)
so guys, help me out here, if there's anything out of order or you have something to chip in on step 4 or 5, please reply.

text: same here, we all feel overwhelmed, i personally started to think of this feeling as fun, and something to look for, something that i get to do instead of something i have to do. and this attitude changed everything for me.

text:
i think you are right....
1. read and research on prompt engineering and its algorithms
    a. understand transformer algorithm
    b. understand basics of gpt
2. then, i believe the next step after setting up your repo is eda on the given datasets and customizing the data to get better performances(results) from the co:here api.
    a. you will be working on creating the best input data out of the given dataset
    b. you consume the co:here api (simply send you prepared data to the api and you receive predictions from the model)
    c. finally you put all these steps together by creating your own api
    d. your api should have two end-point ( i think they behave more or less the same): one endpoint for the news scoring and the other endpoint for extracting entities from job description
        i. so here is what you will do: your api should accept dataset(in json format possibly) then you transform, clean, feature engineer, the received data through your pipeline then send the prepared data to the co:here api, (notice there are two apis involving in this project)....then you present the results via ui
your api accept data->you transform data through pipeline->send prepared data to co:here-> receive predictions -> return the results to the user via ui
that is wha i understood from the guidelines....(please, remind me if i miss anything)

elements.text: i think you are right....
Read and research on prompt engineering and its algorithms
understand transformer algorithm
understand basics of GPT
Then, I believe the next step after setting up your repo is EDA on the given datasets and customizing the data to get better performances(results) from the co:here api.
you will be working on creating the best input data out of the given dataset
you consume the co:here API (simply send you prepared data to the api and you receive predictions from the model)
Finally you put all these steps together by creating your own API
your API should have two end-point ( i think they behave more or less the same): one endpoint for the news scoring and the other endpoint for extracting entities from job description

So here is what you will do: your api should accept dataset(in json format possibly) then you transform, clean, feature engineer, the received data through your pipeline then send the prepared data to the co:here API, (notice there are two APIs involving in this project)....then you present the results via UI

your api accept data->you transform data through pipeline->send prepared data to co:here-> receive predictions -> return the results to the user via ui
that is wha i understood from the guidelines....(please, remind me if i miss anything)

text: also, the best thing i think you can add to this is the schedule and planning part. if you have for example 20 tasks to do it will be very beneficial for you to plan what to do and when to do it. that way you will reduce overthinking and overcommitting on a single specific task. instead, you will try to do all the tasks, instead of overcommitting on a single topic or task that might be a blocker for you. i do not practice what i just preached, but i am trying to do that in order to have the max out of myself and my time. hope that makes sense.

text:
<@u03ujn29y4c> creating endpoints (api in general) with fastapi library is pretty easy
just follow these few steps and you have your api running

(type these command in order to run your api `python3 -m uvicorn main:app --reload` or `python -m uvicorn main:app --reload`)

<https://anderfernandez.com/en/blog/how-to-create-api-python/>
